Params[3]: We should be near, I think...
...I knew it.
Looks like I was right scouting ahead of time.
You must not have been aware, but you've gone off course by two kilometers. You'll end up in the Arctic Ocean if you go any farther.
But the virtual compass indicates...
...Oh, you. All your magnetic navigation systems have to be recalibrated in the Arctic. The Earth's magnetic fields overlap here, so compasses tend to deviate.
I'll lead the way. Otherwise, all the frozen venison we got is going to become shoe leather from the bonfire.
How does it feel being back?
The last time we met was after the battle of Kowloong, huh.
Yeah... Though I only have the backup data from my memories of that time.
You had no choice after all. You had to protect 【kuroname】.
It's great just being able to talk to you again like this.
Us Forest Guards think highly of your actions.
Ah... Is that so?
After all, sacrifice and redemption are two key aspects of our creed. We sincerely respect all brave and noble people.
Well, we think the same for the Forest Guards as well.
I heard from Murray that Babylonia always wanted to officially thank the Forest Guards for their help in the battle of Kowloong, but Rosetta declined.
Diana's expression stiffens, but she remains silent.
She walks in silence, her horns shaking with each step. The rest of you can only follow in silence as well.
...It's Rosetta after all.
It's nothing. As long as we are of help.
We won't let this affect our alliance with Babylonia.
